isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - REMOVE - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the reverse gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 57).

figure.caption: Figure 57. Remove Snap Ring From Reverse Gear

step1.para: Slide the clutch collar into the low or first gear. Move the reverse gear against the low or first gear (Figure 58).

figure.caption: Figure 58. Move Reverse Gear Against Low or First Gear

step1.para: Put a pry bar between the case and the end of the idler shaft to keep the reverse idle shaft for the upper countershaft from moving. Remove the nut and the washer that fastens the gear on the shaft ( Figure 59).

figure.caption: Figure 59. Put Pry Bar Between Case and End of Idler Shaft

step1.para: Remove the upper reverse idler shaft from the rear of the case. Remove the reverse idler gear, the two spacer washers, the bearing race and the needle bearing assembly while removing the shaft (Figure 60).

caution.para: The mainshaft must be supported when the countershaft is serviced. If not supported, the timing marks fall out of alignment. The weight of the mainshaft will also damage the thrust washers between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 60. Remove Reverse Idler Gear, Spacer Washers, Bearing Race and Needle Bearing Assembly

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear and bearing assembly so that the mainshaft is supported in the case.
Design Level 1 Transmissions: remove the selective snap ring for the front upper countershaft bearings in the case. Mark the snap ring for correct installation (Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Remove Selective Snap Ring For Front Upper Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmissions:remove the Allen-head screws that fasten the front upper countershaft retainer to the case. Remove the retainer and shims (Figure 62).
Remove the front upper countershaft bearing cup and cone with a suitable puller ( Figure 63).
If the cup is removed easily, the cup is a "loose" fit cup. Discard and replace with a "press" fit cup and cone assembly. Make sure the correct parts are used.

figure.caption: Figure 63. Remove Front Upper Countershaft Bearing Cup and Cone

step1.para: Design Level 1 Transmissions: remove the selective snap ring for the rear upper countershaft bearing in the case. Mark the snap ring for correct installation ( Figure 64).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Remove Selective Snap Ring For Rear Upper Countershaft Bearing

note.para: Two types of rear countershaft bearing retainers are used on Design Level 2 Transmissions. One retainer is used on transmissions with serial numbers LB93017865 and below. The other retainer is used on transmissions with serial numbers LB93017866 and above. Make sure the correct part is used.

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmissions: remove the fasteners for the rear upper countershaft retainer. Remove the retainer (Figure 65).

Install countershaft bearing pusher tool or equivalent on the front of the countershaft. Rotate the forcing screw until the rear countershaft bearing cup can be removed from the case. Make sure the countershaft does not push against the mainshaft (Figure 66).
If the cup is removed easily, the cup is a "loose" fit cup. Discard and replace with a "press" fit cup and cone assembly. Make sure the correct part is used.

figure.caption: Figure 66. Install Countershaft Bearing Pusher Tool

step1.para: Move the upper countershaft assembly forward and to the side of the case. Make sure the countershaft is separated from the mainshaft assembly.
Remove the auxiliary drive gear from the mainshaft.
Move the reverse gear against the low gear.
Put a rope or a lifting hook under the first-second collar. Slide the mainshaft assembly to the rear of the case (Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Put Rope or Lifting Hook Under First-Second Collar

caution.para: Hold the reverse gear when removing the mainshaft. If not secured, the gear can fall from the shaft.

warning.para: The mainshaft assembly weighs more than 50 pounds. Use a lifting device to remove the mainshaft to avoid serious personal injury.

step1.para: Tilt the front of the mainshaft up and lift the mainshaft assembly from the case (Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Lift Mainshaft Assembly From Case
